availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Jarman (Madison County, student and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Edward B. Jarman and Judith W. Jarman. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Student in Madison County in 1860. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from November 19, 1861 to December 4, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 203B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 154.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 39-40.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 339 and 490.
Find A Grave, "J B Jarman (1843-1862)," Memorial #19984875, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19984875# (accessed December 11, 2018).
